R: @davorbonaci

This should wait until after the release, so that we don't do anything that could cause testing problems.
Run Dataflow RunnableOnService
R: @kennknowles

R: @davorbonaci @jasonkuster this isn't great if the JVM gets killed, but on balance I am for adding this minimal coverage now and improving the safety later

CC: @tgroh looks like this would be enough to catch the streaming side input issue. Rebased on top of your fix.

R: @tgroh 
CC: @aaltay for release FYI. The test has been run offline; we are confident in this solution. This is easy to cherry pick.

@aviemzur test failures are unrelated, they are known flakes that I'm working to fix ASAP.
I'm afraid you'd have to rebase again though.. we're moving fast here  
I will add that this looks great, but I have one comment about composites in general, but via the example of "bounded pipeline" (let's call it batch since we're trying to avoid this term, and since Spark calls it "batch") - `Count.PerElement` is shown as:
`mapPartitions` - makes sense as it maps into KV etc.
`combineByKey` - OK, it uses Spark's combine directly,  
`groupByKey` - ? is it another call to GBK after Combine.PerKey ?
and followed by by another CombineFn call..
This is a bit unclear and I think a bit more thought needs to be put there. I can help with that!

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PreCommit_Java_MavenInstall/8107/

@amitsela 
The `groupByKey` and second `CombineFn` call are the translation of the next 2 transforms in the pipeline, not part of the `Count.perElement` transform translation.
```java
...
PCollection<KV<String, Long>> wordCounts = lines
        .apply(new WordCount.CountWords());

    wordCounts
        .apply(GroupByKey.<String, Long>create())
        .apply(Combine.<String, Long, Long>groupedValues(Sum.ofLongs()));
...
```

Not `R:`ing this yet because there are a couple of changes that are a bit "hacky" here, such as "breaking"  `PipelineResult` API (should be re-designed anyway in [BEAM-849](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-849))
I also wanna give Jenkins a couple of runs on this to see it really does stabilize streaming tests.
Run Spark RunnableOnService
Anyway @staslev PTAL, especially at the change involving `SparkPipelineResult`.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_RunnableOnService_Spark/1128/
--none--
